channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2023100135
item.description:
Report E-2023100135

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: LA CROSSE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XTM experienced an over the road release of UN1760 Biocide 4 from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to a 23' x 5' area of the trailer floor and a 50’ x 2’ area of the gravel lot below due to a puncture caused by a broken pallet. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Floor dry and a citric acid solution were then deployed and utilized to clean the impacted areas. The impacted gravel was shoveled up and the area pH came back at a 7 once all contaminants were removed. All impacted gravel and absorbents were containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was transported to the XPO terminal located in Tomah, WI and staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100304
item.description:
Report E-2023100304

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: ABBOTSFORD
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While parked at a Kwik Trip truck stop, the Veolia driver noticed liquid dripping out of the trailer. Upon investigation, he found a leaking drum with a puncture near the bottom of the container. An overpack was placed underneath the leak to contain as much of the spill as possible until the remediation crew arrived. Approximately 20 gallons of liquid leaked out of the drum. Kwik Trip contacted and emergency response company to assist with clean-up.

Report E-2023100265

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the cap was not tightened down prior to shipment and was loose on one of the poly 275 gallon tote of Cimstar 8227W (UN3082) and had released 0.25 cups of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release.

item.title: Report E-2023100166
item.description:
Report E-2023100166

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 22, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN3265 were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. The damaged jugs were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area and utilized absorbent wipes to remove residual product from the remaining two (2) undamaged jugs. All UN3265-impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023100165
item.description:
Report E-2023100165

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 22, 2023, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN3262 were damaged in a load shift and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools to sweep up the spilled product and debris. The two (2) 50-pound bags and all waste was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.
